column12: note

column5: Mean income or consumption
column11: This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries. Income here is measured before the payment and receipt of taxes and cash benefits.
column12: This data is measured in international-$ at 2017 prices. Household income is divided by the LIS equivalence scale (square root of the total number of household members) to address economies of scale in the household.

column5:

This is market income. Income here is measured before the payment and receipt of taxes and cash benefits.

Household income is divided by the LIS equivalence scale (square root of the total number of household members) to address economies of scale in the household.

This is the mean income within the poorest decile (tenth of the population).

This is disposable household income. Income here is measured after taxes and social security contributions.

Household income is divided by the LIS equivalence scale (square root of the total number of household members) to address economies of scale in the household.
